description: The tiger is a large striped big cat native to Asia and is an apex predator in its range.
They hunt ungulates and are solitary hunters with large territories.
Turtles are reptiles with a bony or cartilaginous shell, occupying marine, freshwater and terrestrial habitats.
Their diets vary from herbivorous to carnivorous depending on species.
Toucans are colourful birds with large bills native to the Neotropics, feeding primarily on fruit.
They inhabit tropical forests and are important seed dispersers.
Tapirs are large browsing mammals with a short prehensile snout, found in Central/South America and Southeast Asia.
They feed on leaves, shoots, and fruit in forested habitats.
Trout are freshwater fish in the salmon family important to ecosystems and fisheries, often found in cool, clear streams and lakes.
They feed on invertebrates and small fish.
